stance_1: I have a large family to feed
stance_2: I want to get enough protein
justification: The interviewee directly states that feeding a large family is a reason to include meat for protein.

stance_1: I have a large family to feed
stance_2: I want to keep my family full
justification: The interviewee explicitly connects feeding a large family to choosing meat for satiety.

stance_1: I have meat-free nights each week
justification: The main reason given for meat-free nights is the high cost of meat.

stance_1: I have meat-free nights each week
stance_2: Others eat more meat than my family
justification: Having meat-free nights likely contributes to the perception that others eat more meat than the interviewee's family.

stance_1: I switch to ground turkey or chicken when on sale
justification: Switching to cheaper meats when on sale is motivated by the high cost of meat.

stance_1: I switch to ground turkey or chicken when on sale
stance_2: Price is a main factor for people I know
justification: The interviewee states that price is a main factor, which is reflected in switching meats when there's a sale.

stance_1: I eat mostly ground beef and chicken
stance_2: I want to get enough protein
justification: Eating these meats is described as a way to get enough protein for the family.

stance_1: I eat mostly ground beef and chicken
stance_2: I want to keep my family full
justification: The interviewee says meat is used to keep the family full.

stance_2: Price is a main factor for people I know
justification: The high cost of meat underpins price being a main factor for meat consumption choices.

stance_1: Others eat more meat than my family
stance_2: I have a large family to feed
justification: Despite having a large family (which might suggest higher consumption), the interviewee's family eats less meat than others, suggesting conflicting influences (cost, practices, etc).

stance_1: Price is a main factor for people I know
stance_2: Some people avoid red meat for health
justification: Health and price are presented as distinct motivations for reducing or changing meat consumption, suggesting a mild conflict between these rationales.
